175.title: Why has Thailand Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha been suspended?
175.article_body: Thailand PM Prayuth Chan-ocha was suspended from official duties by the country's Constitutional Court on Wednesday. The suspension came after the court decided to hear a petition seeking review of his legally mandated eight-year term limit. The petition, filed by the main opposition party, said Prayuth's time spent as head of a military junta should count towards his term.

176.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flags off 97 electric buses today
176.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal inaugurated 97 more electric buses at Rajghat Depot-I today, taking the total number of electric buses in Delhi Transport Corporation's (DTC) fleet to 249. Each one of the buses is estimated to cut 0.33 million tonnes of PM 2.5 and PM 10 carbon dioxide (CO2) each in its life span of 10 years, officials said.

177.title: Delhi AIIMS mess shut over unhygienic conditions reopened in an hour: Doctors
177.article_body: The hostel mess of Delhi AIIMS, shut by FSSAI over several irregularities and unhygienic conditions, was reopened within an hour, Resident Doctors Association (RDA) alleged. The administration didn't take any steps to address the issues, it claimed. RDA, in a letter to AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria, stated pests were found in food during a surprise inspection on August 10.

178.title: AAP MLAs being given threat of CBI and ED: Arvind Kejriwal
178.article_body: Addressing an inauguration event, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "In the last 2-3 days, some AAP MLAs have told me that they are being given the threat of CBI and ED." "They are being lured with money to leave AAP, this is a very serious issue. We have called a meeting of our political affairs at 4 pm," he added.

179.title: B'luru software engineers booked for raising pro-Pak slogans on Clubhouse
179.article_body: Two software engineers from Bengaluru have been booked for allegedly raising pro-Pakistan slogans on audio chat app Clubhouse on August 15 and August 16. The two had reportedly urged members who were part of the discussion to change their display picture to the Pakistan flag. However, police haven't made any arrests yet, stating those involved had no connection with Pakistan.

180.title: Farmer who sent workers home on a plane during lockdown found hanging in Delhi temple
180.article_body: A 55-year-old farmer who sent his workers home to Bihar on a plane during the 2020 COVID-19 lockdown was found hanging in a temple in Delhi on Wednesday. Pappan Singh Gehlot was found hanging at the temple in front of his house in the Alipore area of Delhi. Police officials also recovered a note.

181.title: This is lobbying: Vivek on Dylan Mohan calling 'Kashmir...' 'garbage'
181.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has reacted to Canadian filmmaker Dylan Mohan Gray's comments on his film 'The Kashmir Files'. "This is all lobbying and politics. My political acumen is better than most filmmakers...Tell me, how did someone sitting in Canada notice my film? That means somebody is lobbying," Vivek said. Dylan had called Vivek's film 'hate-mongering garbage'.

182.title: We're taking it seriously, DGP is monitoring: Goa CM on Sonali Phogat's death
182.article_body: Following BJP leader Sonali Phogat’s death in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, "We're taking it seriously." He added, "DGP himself is monitoring. Investigation and post-mortem reports will come to him. Preliminary, as per doctors and DGP, it seems to be cardiac arrest," Sawant added. Phogat's sister Raman has said their family isn't ready to accept she died of heart attack.

183.title: Shooting of Kamal Haasan's 'Indian 2' resumes after a 2-year gap
183.article_body: Filmmaker Shankar took to Twitter and announced that they have resumed the shoot of Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Indian 2' after two years. "We are glad to announce that the remaining shoot for 'Indian 2' is commencing today! Need all of your support and wishes," Shankar tweeted. The shoot halted in February 2020 after an accident on set killed three people.

184.title: Spent under ₹10 cr annually on promotions: Dolo 650 manufacturer amid freebies claim
184.article_body: Micro Labs, the manufacturer of Dolo 650, said that it spent under ₹10 crore annually on brand marketing and promotion. It added that the only freebies it gave out included books, pens and small mementoes. The company’s clarification comes at a time when it is being accused of offering freebies worth ₹1,000 crore to doctors to promote Dolo 650.

185.title: Finland's PM Sanna Marin apologises for pic of 2 topless women kissing at her residence
185.article_body: Finland's PM Sanna Marin has apologised for a photo taken at her official residence which showed two women kissing, lifting their tops to bare their torsos and covering their breasts with a sign reading 'Finland'. This comes after a video surfaced showing Marin partying with a group of friends and celebrities, after which she had to take a drug test.

186.title: KKR were 7 down, needed 80 runs; McCullum said 'Just 13 more sixes': Venkatesh
186.article_body: Recalling an anecdote from an IPL match where KKR had lost seven wickets with 80 runs required, KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said the franchise's former coach Brendon McCullum met the players and said, "Just 13 more sixes needed." "That...makes you feel that you will be able to achieve it," added Venkatesh. "McCullum doesn't let the pressure affect anyone," he stated.

187.title: Nobody can put pressure on 'Mahagathbandhan' govt: JD(U) MLC on CBI raids
187.article_body: JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar said the central government has used CBI and ED as government instruments after the CBI raided the residences of two RJD leaders. "Bihar is the land of democracy and [it] does not matter if you send a dozen agencies, there is no one to create pressure on 'Mahagathbandhan' government," Kumar added.

188.title: Even when I was coach we discussed we were a bit timid at the top: Shastri
188.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said India should continue with their "aggressive" approach in T20Is. "It's the right approach...If you start winning with this approach, you can take that confidence in big games," he added. "Even when I was coach, we discussed we were a bit timid at the top considering the players we had down the order," added Shastri.

189.title: Shaheen Bagh protest not independent movement, backed by PFI: Delhi Police to HC
189.article_body: The protests at Shaheen Bagh for Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) were not organic or an independent movement, Delhi Police told the Delhi High Court. Popular Front of India (PFI) and Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) were behind the protests and locals did not support it at various places, the police said, adding that people were transferred to these sites.

190.title: BJP offered 4 AAP MLAs ₹20 cr each to switch sides: MP Sanjay Singh
190.article_body: BJP offered four AAP MLAs ₹20 crore each if they switched sides and ₹25 crore if they bring other party leaders with them, Delhi Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh claimed. "In Maharashtra, MLAs are protesting 'Khokha-Khokha 50 Khokha'," he added. "Like BJP formed government in Maharashtra, MP, Arunachal, Karnataka...Manipur, similar efforts are being made in Delhi," AAP's Durgesh Pathak said.

191.title: His craze increased due to The Kapil Sharma Show: Late singer KK's son
191.article_body: Late singer KK's son Nakul said his father's popularity had increased after his appearance on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. "After ['The Kapil Sharma Show'], the craze went even higher," he said. Daughter Taamara added, "Dad didn't do TV much, but after that, people were so happy to see him." KK had featured in the show with Shaan and Palash Sen.

192.title: Tata Sons may have to write-off AirAsia India's losses: Report
192.article_body: Tata Sons might have to make a ₹2,600 crore provision as accumulated losses for AirAsia India as Tata-owned Air India seeks to fully acquire the latter's equity share capital, according to a report. Tata Sons has 83.67% stake in AirAsia India. Whether the write-off will be included in Tata Sons or Air India's balance sheet is yet to be decided.

193.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates Asia's largest private hospital in Faridabad
193.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated Amrita Hospital in Faridabad's Sector-88. The 2,600-bed hospital, managed by Mata Amritanandamayi Math, is claimed to be Asia's largest private hospital. "The hospital, which is being constructed at an estimated cost of around ₹6,000 crore, will provide state-of-the-art healthcare facilities to the people of Faridabad and the entire NCR region," PM said.

194.title: Felt awkward buying pregnancy kit, everyone knew I just had baby: Debina
194.article_body: Actress Debina Bonnerjee, who recently announced her second pregnancy, has revealed that she felt awkward while buying a pregnancy kit. "The whole world knows I just had a baby...I..ordered it online," she added. Debina further said that she was shocked, extremely happy and did not know what to do next after she got to know she was pregnant.

195.title: Deepak Chahar should be 'first-choice' pacer for India in Asia Cup: L Balaji
195.article_body: Ex-India pacer L Balaji has said pacer Deepak Chahar, who has been named among the back-ups for the Asia Cup, should be a "first-choice" bowler in the tournament. "In the UAE...the new ball skills are needed...If Bumrah and Shami are not available, Chahar is the one who provides that," stated Balaji. Chahar registered figures of 3/27 and 2/75 against Zimbabwe.

196.title: Police carries out flag march as protests erupt over Prophet remarks in Hyd
196.article_body: The Telangana Police on Wednesday carried out a flag march in Hyderabad after protests erupted against suspended BJP leader T Raja Singh. Meanwhile, all petrol pumps across parts of Hyderabad Old City were closed amid the protests. This comes after Raja Singh was granted bail hours after his arrest on Tuesday over his alleged remarks against Islam and Prophet Muhammad.

197.title: BEST will operate additional buses during Ganeshotsav, double-deckers for Lalbaug
197.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) will launch buses from 11 pm to 6 am to help devotees have 'darshans' of various idols during Ganeshotsav. The authorities have launched over 3,300 MSRTC bus routes to meet the demands starting at month-end. BEST is also planning to run double-deckers from 10 pm to 6 am for several areas including Lalbaug.

198.title: Release of Bilkis' convicts shows our failure, I will request PM to undo it: BJP leader
198.article_body: Senior BJP leader Shanta Kumar has criticised the Gujarat government for releasing the 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. He said, "I'll request the Prime Minister to use his influence to undo this remission...it shows our failed commitment to protecting women." He also said, "I bow my head in shame", adding that the convicts should be hanged.

199.title: Hearing this from media: Gehlot on reports of being offered Cong chief post
199.article_body: Amid reports that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has been offered the Congress President post by the party's President Sonia Gandhi, Gehlot said, "I'm hearing this from the media." He added, "I don't know about this. I am fulfilling duties that have been assigned to me." Earlier, Gehlot had said that Rahul Gandhi should accept Congress President’s post.

200.title: Sundaram Mutual launches Sundaram Flexi Cap Fund, NFO closes Aug 30
200.article_body: Sundaram Mutual launched an open-ended equity scheme, Sundaram Flexi Cap NFO closing on August 30. "Flexi Cap Funds can outperform over market cycles. They allow for greater diversification & investors can stay invested in the best cap curves, sectors, stocks across all market scenarios, relaxing while the fund manager optimizes opportunities for them," said Sunil Subramaniam, MD, Sundaram Mutual.

201.title: Waited for 8 hrs due to discussion on Shahid's shoes: Kiara on Kabir Singh
201.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said she b**ch-slapped Shahid Kapoor, who was her co-star in 'Kabir Singh', "in her head" as she had to "wait for eight hours" due to a discussion on Shahid's shoes for a scene. Kiara revealed this during an episode of 'Koffee with Karan 7', where Shahid was present. Host Karan Johar said he'd have done the same.

202.title: Twitter merges misinformation & spam teams amid whistleblower’s claims
202.article_body: Twitter is combining its health experience and the Twitter service teams to reduce toxic content and spam bots amid claims by whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko. The 'health' team works on reducing misinformation and harmful content, while the service team reviews reported profiles and takes down spam accounts. The new group will be called 'Health Products and Services'.

203.title: HPCL starts work on first cow dung-based compressed biogas project
203.article_body: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) on Tuesday started its first cow dung-to-compressed biogas project in Rajasthan's Sanchore. Under the GOBAR-Dhan scheme, the plant will utilise 100 tonnes of cow dung per day to produce biogas, which will then be used as automotive fuel. The plant is slated to be commissioned in a year. The groundbreaking ceremony took place in Pathmeda.

204.title: Clickbait journalism: Meesho CEO on report claiming company planning a down round
204.article_body: Addressing a media report alleging Meesho evaluating a down round at a valuation at least 25% down from its last funding round, CEO Vidit Aatrey called it a "false" story. Aatrey wrote, "Sad to see this clickbait journalism. Fabricating stories about townhalls that never happened to "source driven" fake anecdotes of a down round...Be more responsible about what you write".

205.title: Kerala govt moves HC against sessions court judge's 'sexually provocative dress' remark
205.article_body: Kerala government moved the High Court against Kozhikode Sessions Court judge's "sexually provocative dress" remark and sought to set aside the order granting anticipatory bail to author Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case. The government submitted a plea stating that the findings of the court are "illegal, unjust and have the effect of potentially exposing survivor to secondary trauma".

206.title: 1,000 Ganesh Mandals get approval via Pune Police's single window system
206.article_body: About 1,000 of 1,200 applications pertaining to pandals and loudspeakers for Ganesh Mandals have been approved so far via Pune Police's single window system at police stations. Through the single window programme, launched for Ganeshotsav Mandals, police verify applications and authorisation is granted swiftly. "We have given permission to many Mandals within an hour," DCP Priyanka Narnaware said.

207.title: Came to Mumbai to become SRK, realised there can't be another SRK: Sohum
207.article_body: Actor Sohum Shah has said that he came to Mumbai to become another Shah Rukh Khan, however, he added, "I realised there cannot be another Shah Rukh Khan in the industry." Sohum further stated that his choice of projects so far was not a deliberate decision. "I have learnt to go with the flow in the past decade," he added.

208.title: Athiya, KL Rahul's wedding will happen as soon as they decide: Suniel
208.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty, speaking about daughter Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul's wedding plans, has said, "It will happen as soon as the kids decide." He added that Rahul has a busy schedule due to upcoming tours. "The wedding will happen only when the kids get a break," he stated. "The wedding will be planned when there's time," he added.

209.title: Real test for him starts now: Karim on Gill's performances vs Zimbabwe, WI
209.article_body: With Shubman Gill scoring 205 runs in three WI ODIs and 245 in as many Zimbabwe ODIs, Saba Karim has said the "real test" for the 22-year-old will start now. "[Bowlers] will devise plans to get him out," he added. "This is the new breed of Indian cricketers who've been impressive...Shubman is right up in the pecking order," stated Karim.

210.title: Oppn parties should keep aside differences, unite against BJP: Pawar
210.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Opposition parties should keep aside their differences and unite to take on the BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. He said he would make efforts to unite non-BJP political parties. "We political leaders may not be that intelligent...common man is intelligent. The common man will teach BJP a lesson in 2024," Pawar added.

211.title: No delay in variable payout process, 100% being paid in Q1: TCS
211.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Tuesday denied media reports that claimed the company had delayed the variable pay for senior employees for the June quarter. "We have come across completely incorrect reports...Variable pay is either paid in month one or month two...and there is no delay in this process. 100% variable pay is being paid for Q1," TCS said.

212.title: AAP ignored recommendations of expert panel on excise policy: BJP
212.article_body: The BJP on Tuesday alleged that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP)-led Delhi government had ignored recommendations of an expert committee formed to reform liquor trade in the capital. For example, the expert committee was against promotions to push liquor sales, said BJP MP Parvesh Verma. However, the Delhi government gave a carton free on every carton sold, he added.

213.title: Centre issues advisory to states on Tomato Flu
213.article_body: Centre has issued an advisory to states on Hand, Foot and Mouth Disease or Tomato Flu. It is a self-limiting illness mostly targeting young children aged 1-10 years and immunocompromised adults with no specific drug to treat it. The virus is not related to SARS-CoV-2, monkeypox, dengue or chikungunya. Best prevention is maintenance of proper hygiene and sanitisation of surroundings.

214.title: Had rejected 1200-1300 proposals: Actress Kanishka who married herself
214.article_body: TV actress Kanishka Soni, who claims that she's married to herself, said she rejected "1200-1300" proposals. "A very famous actor proposed to me for marriage, but his real face was uncovered in...two months...He was very violent," added Kanishka. "For an A-grade film in 2008, the producer asked me to visit his house so he could see my stomach," she stated.

215.title: I'll try to get fully fit for T20 World Cup: Buttler on calf injury in The Hundred
215.article_body: England limited-overs captain Jos Buttler, who has been ruled out of the remaining games in The Hundred with a calf injury, has said he'll try to get "fully fit" for the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "It's frustrating...I've really been enjoying playing," he added. Currently, Buttler is the sixth-highest run-getter in the tournament with 203 runs.

216.title: BJP stooped even lower: RJD on CBI raids on its leaders
216.article_body: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) criticised BJP after the CBI raided the residences of two RJD leaders just ahead of the floor test in the Bihar Assembly. "Our Deputy CM had said in the meeting yesterday that they will reach this level now. It didn't take even 24 hours. They stooped down even lower," RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha said.

217.title: Vijay Kumar Sinha resigns as Speaker of the Bihar Assembly
217.article_body: Vijay Kumar Sinha has resigned as the Speaker of the Bihar Assembly. This comes ahead of the floor test in the state Assembly. Notably, Sinha on Tuesday refused to resign from his position. "RJD legislators had not served me the no-confidence motion on August 9 in a proper format. They did so on August 10," he said.

218.title: Noida twin tower demolition will see over 1,000 truck loads of debris: Official
218.article_body: After the demolition of Noida's illegal Supertech twin towers on Sunday, around 1,200 to 1,300 truck-loads of debris would have to be moved out from the site, an Edifice Engineering partner Utkarsh Mehta said. According to the estimates prepared by project officials, the demolition of the towers would leave behind approximately 35,000 cubic metres of debris to be cleared.

219.title: Video shows woman beating Zomato delivery agent with shoe, company responds
219.article_body: A video of a woman beating a Zomato delivery agent with her shoe has surfaced on social media. A Twitter user who shared the video, wrote that the woman took his order from the delivery agent and the latter was left "terrified that he would lose his job". Meanwhile, Zomato replied to the video and wrote, "We're getting this checked."

220.title: I usually hit '100-150' sixes daily during practice: Pak batter Asif Ali
220.article_body: Pakistan batter Asif Ali said he "usually hits 100 to 150 sixes daily" during practice sessions, so that he can hit four to five sixes during the match. "I bat at a position where an average of over 10 is required. For that, you need to hit big shots and that requires a lot of practice," added Asif.

221.title: Dubbing was essential in 90s, South actresses couldn't speak proper Hindi: Anu
221.article_body: Actress Anu Aggarwal refuted rumours that her voice was dubbed in the 1990 film 'Aashiqui'. "I haven't heard of this one. Fake rumour," she said. Speaking about South actresses being dubbed in the 1990s, she stated, "At that time, many actresses from the South couldn't speak proper Hindi. So, dubbing was essential." 'Aashiqui' was directed by Mahesh Bhatt.

222.title: 'Soon will realise the sofa I'm sitting on is bought,' Mahua shares text on Adani-NDTV move
222.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra has shared a text message she received as Adani Group acquired 29.18% stake in television channel NDTV, which read, "Soon I will be watching Netflix and then I will realise they've bought the sofa I'm sitting on." Notably, NDTV said that 29% of the media company was acquired without any discussion, consent or notice.

223.title: He had you doing a 360: Ferdinand on Ronaldo snubbing Carragher
223.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo ignoring an attempted handshake by ex-Liverpool defender Jamie Carragher, before Manchester United's win against Liverpool, ex-Manchester United footballer Rio Ferdinand jokingly tweeted, "[He] had Carragher doing a 360 like the old days." "Bad night from start to finish...Blanked by...Ronaldo...& Liverpool all over the place!" read Carragher's reaction on Twitter.

224.title: I said no need to pay heed to those who spread misconception: Teni on 'dog' remark
224.article_body: Following his "dogs bark on road or chase car" remark, Union Minister Ajay Misra Teni said, "I just said there's no need to pay heed to such people who spread misconception." He added, "When workers asked me about Rakesh Tikait's viral video where he maybe mentions people of Lakhimpur Kheri to be goons, I simply said...it's below my level."

225.title: Oil prices fall amid receding fears of OPEC+ cutting production
225.article_body: Oil prices declined on Wednesday amid receding fears of OPEC+ cutting production to stabilise the market after a recent drop in oil futures. Brent crude futures fell 21 cents to $100.01 a barrel, while the US West Texas Intermediate crude futures contract dropped 10 cents to $93.64 a barrel. The prices had risen 3.9% and 3.7%, respectively, on Tuesday.

226.title: Forced to file FIR: MP health official after 3 journalists booked over a story
226.article_body: A medical officer in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind, Rajeev Kaurav, on whose complaint three journalists were booked, purportedly said that he was "forced to file the FIR". "How can I file the complaint when I don't even know their names?" Kaurav added. The journalists were booked over a story on a family taking a man to a hospital on a cart.

227.title: Casemiro receives text from Real Madrid star's girlfriend after Man Utd move, pic viral
227.article_body: After midfielder Casemiro joined Manchester United, his former Real Madrid teammate Federico Valverde's girlfriend Mina Bonino sent him a WhatsApp message asking him to not leave Real Madrid. Mina shared a screenshot of the text on Twitter, which went viral. "Don't leave, you s**t b*****d," the translation of the text read. Casemiro won five Champions League titles with Real Madrid.

228.title: 4 hurt in protests against suspended BJP MLA over Prophet remarks in Hyd
228.article_body: Four people, including a police sub-inspector, were injured during protests against suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh in Hyderabad on Tuesday night. Protests followed by instances of violence broke out after Singh got bail following his arrest by the Hyderabad police. This comes after Raja Singh released a video wherein he passed derogatory comments about Prophet Muhammad.

229.title: We missed Hardik Pandya badly in last year's T20 WC: Ravi Shastri
229.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya is "one of the most important cogs in the wheel" for the team. "You take Hardik out of the squad and the balance goes away...We missed him really badly in the 2021 (T20) WC," added Shastri. "There's no one close to Hardik when it comes to quality," he further said.

230.title: Eradicate 'orderly' system in police completely in 4 months: Madras HC
230.article_body: Madras High Court (HC) on Tuesday directed the Tamil Nadu government, the Director-General of Police and the Greater Chennai Police Commissioner to completely eradicate the "orderly" system in police in four months. "Though these police personnel are working as menials in the residence of the higher police officials, they are to be construed as 'oppressed and depressed' class," HC stated.

231.title: Meghan reveals she had to continue royal tour after son's room caught fire in 2019
231.article_body: Meghan Markle has revealed how she and Prince Harry left their son Archie and proceeded for an "official engagement" shortly after the baby's room caught fire in 2019. She said that while they were on South Africa tour as part of their royal duties, a fire broke out in his nursery minutes before he was taken out of there.

232.title: No split in MVA, united to take on Shinde-Fadnavis govt: Ex-Maha CM
232.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, while chairing a meeting with Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) partners Shiv Sena, NCP, Congress and other smaller parties on Tuesday, announced that there was no split amongst them. He added that the MVA partners will together take on Shinde-Fadnavis government on key issues in the next assembly elections. "We'll fight but...not back down," he added.

233.title: Europe is facing its worst drought in 500 years: Report
233.article_body: A report by the European Commission's science and knowledge service, the Joint Research Centre, shows that nearly two-thirds of Europe is threatened by drought. The drought may be the worst in "at least 500 years", Johannes Bahrke, European Commission spokesperson, said. The report mentioned that 47% of Europe is under warning conditions with a soil moisture deficit.

234.title: Ex-police officer pleads guilty for role in Breonna Taylor shooting
234.article_body: A former police officer in Louisiana, Kelly Goodlett, has pleaded guilty in federal court for helping falsify a search warrant that led to shooting of a black woman, Breonna Taylor in 2020. Goodlett pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy. The former police officer could face a five-year prison term, a $250,000 fine and three years of supervised release.

235.title: Markets open flat with Sensex down 16 points, Nifty at 17,579.7
235.article_body: The benchmark indices opened flat on Wednesday amid weak global cues with the Sensex falling 16.32 points to 59,014.98. The Nifty rose by 2.20 points to 17,579.70. ONGC, IndusInd Bank, Apollo Hospitals and Sun Pharma were among the major Nifty gainers. Stocks of Bharti Airtel, Eicher Motors, Asian Paints and Grasim Industries slipped. Nearly 1,419 shares advanced and 501 declined.

236.title: India reports 10,649 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 24% higher than yesterday
236.article_body: India has reported 10,649 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in the last 24 hours including four reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Health Ministry. Active cases in the country stood at 96,442, while the daily positivity rate increased slightly to 2.62%. India also reported 10,677 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,37,44,301.

237.title: Meat seized at cold storage in Mumbai found to be beef, case filed
237.article_body: The Mumbai Police booked the manager and owner of a cold storage company after frozen beef worth ₹1.5 crore was found in their storage. Police took action after the company failed to provide documents in support of the commodity seized at their premises. The samples were later sent for forensic tests and report revealed that the frozen meats were beef.

238.title: Shehzada will do remarkably well, don't have fear of boycotting: Ankur
238.article_body: Actor Ankur Rathee, who will next feature in Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Shehzada', has said that the film will do "remarkably well". "This is an action-packed comedy that people will find themselves laughing at and enjoying themselves," he said. Ankur further added, "I don't have any fear in terms of boycotting or something like that." The film will also feature Kriti Sanon.

239.title: You're wrong, I'm coming: Vijay on SRK calling himself the 'last' superstar
239.article_body: Reacting to Shah Rukh Khan calling himself the "last" superstar, actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "I...wanted to say, 'SRK, you're wrong. You're not the last. I'm coming.'" Deverakonda earlier said he wants to steal SRK's title of "King". Deverakonda further shared he feels "insulted" if somebody terms his performance as "good", adding that it has to be "extraordinary".

240.title: I'll kill myself if athletes complain: UP official whose objectionable pics went viral
240.article_body: After UP Olympic Association's Secretary General Anandeshwar Panday's pictures in compromising position with different women went viral and a report was sought by Regional Sports Officer Lucknow, Panday said, "Somebody is out to defame me." He added, "If an...athlete...ever complains against me, hang me. I'll kill myself. I've been in sports since...1970s, there has never been any such incident."

241.title: Media persons against Bihar CM as they are not getting liquor: JD(U) chief
241.article_body: JD(U) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh on Tuesday said several media persons are against Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as "they are not getting liquor". "Liquor ban was done on the demands of women in Bihar," Singh said. "What can we do? Would the CM think of his people or worry about journalists not being able to enjoy themselves?" he asked.

242.title: Ex-Punjab minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu sent to police custody till Aug 27
242.article_body: Former Punjab Food and Civil Supplies Minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu has been sent to police custody till August 27 in connection with the alleged food grains transportation tenders scam. Ashu was arrested from Ludhiana by Punjab Vigilance Bureau on Monday. Commenting on allegations of "political vendetta", CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said that "law is taking its own course."

243.title: Dorsey had 'drastic loss of focus' in last year as Twitter CEO: Whistleblower
243.article_body: Whistleblower Peiter Zatko alleged that Jack Dorsey suffered a "drastic loss of focus" in his final year as Twitter CEO. In his complaint, Zatko claimed that Dorsey was "extremely disengaged" during the last months of his tenure as CEO and wouldn't even speak during meetings on complex issues facing the company. Dorsey stepped down as Twitter CEO in 2021.

244.title: Rahul Gandhi can't be forced to take over as Cong President: Digvijaya
244.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said Rahul Gandhi cannot be forced to take over as Congress President. Meanwhile, another Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said no one outside the Gandhi family can lead the party now. The Indian Express quoted Chowdhury as saying, "Either Rahul Ji or Sonia Ji. We don’t have any other alternative. Whatever people may say...that's the reality."

245.title: CBI raids 2 RJD leaders in Bihar in land for railways jobs case ahead of floor test
245.article_body: CBI on Wednesday morning raided two Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leaders in Bihar in an alleged land for railways jobs case. CBI raided RJD MLC Sunil Singh's residence in Patna reportedly in connection with the case. "It is being done intentionally. There is no meaning to it," Singh said. Notably, this comes ahead of the Bihar Assembly floor test today.

246.title: Sonali said something fishy is going on, she cut the call & didn't pick up: Sister
246.article_body: Late BJP leader Sonali Phogat's sister Rupesh said she received a call from her before her death, where she said she wanted to talk on WhatsApp, adding that something fishy was going on. "Later, she cut the call and didn't pick up," Rupesh said. Sonali's sister Raman said their family is not ready to accept she died of heart attack.

247.title: It's going to take a special delivery to get Babar out in Asia Cup: Styris
247.article_body: Ex-New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris has said it's going to take a "special delivery" to dismiss Pakistan captain Babar Azam in the upcoming Asia Cup. "What [bowlers] look to do is to give Babar a single and get him off strike and bowl [to] the [other] guy," added Styris. Currently, Babar is the top-ranked batter in both ODIs and T20Is.

248.title: Hospitals being run like companies where profit making is more important: CJI
248.article_body: Private hospitals are being opened at an exponential rate which is not necessarily a bad thing, but there is a "glaring need for balance", CJI NV Ramana said. "We're seeing hospitals being run like companies, where profit making is more important than service to society," he added. "Due to this, hospitals...doctors alike are desensitised towards patients' plight," he stated.

249.title: Delhi Police's new Commissioner to restart 'Jan Sunwai' after 2 years
249.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Sanjay Arora will begin 'Jan Sunwai' (public hearing) in his office at police headquarters from today. This will be the first 'Jan Sunwai' session by a Delhi Police chief in the past two years as the practice was stopped due to COVID-19. 'Jan Sunwai' will be held from Monday to Friday from 10 am to 12 noon.

250.title: Sonali told mother she can sense problem as if someone was doing something to her: Sister
250.article_body: Late Sonali Phogat's sister Raman said their mother spoke to her on Monday and Sonali told her, "Mummy, I'm feeling slightly upset in the stomach. I can sense some problem soon after eating my food as if somebody was doing something to me." Sonali said that she was feeling as if some conspiracy was being played on her, Raman added.

251.title: I support Man Utd but Liverpool were better: Schweinsteiger on Utd's win
251.article_body: Discussing Manchester United's 2-1 win against Liverpool, World Cup-winning German footballer Bastian Schweinsteiger said he supports United, but admitted that Liverpool were the better team with much more possession. "They couldn't finish their last passes otherwise they would've won," added Schweinsteiger. "Was this the way United want to play football?...That was survival mode," he stated.

252.title: B'luru Metro's Electronic City corridor to be ready by June 2023: BMRCL
252.article_body: Bengaluru Metro's Electronic City corridor will begin operations in June 2023, according to representatives from Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL). The entire Yellow Line will begin operations in two phases. While the Bommasandra to Central Silk Board section will start functioning in June, the section from Central Silk Board to RV Road will be opened by December 2023.

253.title: I choose films that make little more sense with genuine story: Nithya Menen
253.article_body: Actress Nithya Menen has said that commercial cinema does not excite her. "When it comes to commercial cinema, you pick and choose what you want and package it in a way so that you can sell it to the audience," she stated. Nithya added that she chooses films that "make a little more sense" and have a genuine story.

254.title: Transform your career with MTech Data Science & Engineering: BITS Pilani
254.article_body: According to a Markets and Markets report, Data Science Platform Market size is set to expand at CAGR of 27.7% to reach USD 322.9 billion by 2026. BITS Pilani WILP encourages learners to get ahead of their peers by pursuing its MTech Data Science and Engineering and build their careers as Data Analysts, Data Architects, Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

255.title: 7 history-sheeters held in connection with Pune petrol pump robbery bid
255.article_body: Pune City Police arrested seven history-sheeters in connection with a petrol pump robbery bid. This comes after police received a tip-off of an attempt to rob a petrol pump in Mangalwar Peth. Police seized 20 mobile phones worth ₹1.07 lakh from their possession. Notably, around eight criminal cases for robbery are registered in Delhi and Secunderabad against the prime accused.

256.title: Musk's ex-girlfriend auctions their pics, gifts to raise money for son's college fee
256.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s ex-girlfriend, Jennifer Gwynne, is auctioning off photographs and personal items from their one-year relationship to raise money for her stepson's college tuition. Gwynne reportedly dated Musk in 1994, when they were in their 20s and were studying at the University of Pennsylvania. The items to be auctioned included their pictures, Musk's handwritten note and a necklace.

257.title: Hyd Police auctions off 1,142 abandoned vehicles for over ₹64 lakh
257.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday organised an auction of 1,150 abandoned and unclaimed vehicles and collected ₹64,63,200. Out of the total vehicles, 1060 abandoned vehicles in scrap condition were auctioned for ₹53 lakh, whereas 82 two-wheelers in roadworthy condition were auctioned for over ₹11 lakh, police said. About 550 bidders from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana were present at the event.

258.title: Mumbai Metro Line 7 & 2A 98% ready, trial runs to commence by Oct: MMRDA
258.article_body: The under-construction Metro Line 7 from the Western Express Highway and Line 2A from Link Road are both 98 percent complete and Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is planning to begin the trial runs by October this year. MMRDA also aims to start the remaining stretch of commercial operations by December this year.

259.title: Sonia Gandhi to travel abroad for medical check-up; Rahul, Priyanka to accompany her
259.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi will be travelling abroad on Wednesday for medical check-ups, the party said late on Tuesday night. Sonia will be accompanied by her children Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. She will also visit her ailing mother before returning to New Delhi, AICC general secretary in-charge of communication Jairam Ramesh said.

260.title: Execs allowed Twitter to become dependent on money from Chinese entities: Whistleblower
260.article_body: Whistleblower Peiter Zatko, in his disclosure to Congress and federal agencies, alleged that Twitter executives allowed the microblogging platform to become more dependent upon revenue coming from Chinese entities. This was despite the fact that Twitter is blocked in China, he added. Twitter executives knew that accepting Chinese money risked endangering users in China, the disclosure read.

261.title: Who is Peiter 'Mudge' Zatko, the Twitter whistleblower?
261.article_body: Peiter 'Mudge' Zatko, who filed a whistleblower disclosure with the US Securities and Exchange Commission against Twitter, was Twitter's security chief from November 2020 to January 2022. He is a famous hacker and one of US' top cybersecurity experts. Before Twitter, Zatko oversaw security at the electronic payments company Stripe. He also worked on special projects at Google.

262.title: Brother-sister duo, associate held for murder in Delhi's Jamia Nagar
262.article_body: A Nasir gang sharpshooter, identified as Sultan Azim, his sister and their associate were arrested for allegedly killing a 30-year-old man to usurp his flat in Delhi's Jamia Nagar, police said. Azim executed the murder following his release from jail three to four months ago, police added. Azim was involved in a Delhi policeman's murder in Karkardooma Court in 2015.

263.title: Thane family runs out of their house after leopard enters in
263.article_body: A leopard entered a family's house in Umbarkhand village in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday after which the family ran out of the residence and locked the leopard inside it. Later, the leopard was rescued by the forest officials. The female leopard, believed to be two-three years old, entered the residence's kitchen area when Lahu Nimse's family was asleep, officials said.

264.title: Twitter CEO suggested the company become complicit with the Putin regime: Whistleblower
264.article_body: Twitter's current CEO Parag Agrawal suggested that the microblogging platform become complicit with Russian President Vladimir Putin's regime, whistleblower Peiter Zatko stated. "It is a cause for concern about Twitter's effects on US national security," he added. Zatko further stated that Agrawal's suggestions were discarded.

265.title: Told Yuvraj that hundred isn't coming, he asked me not to worry: Gill
265.article_body: India opener Shubman Gill revealed he met former cricketer Yuvraj Singh ahead of the Zimbabwe tour and it was his advice that worked for the batter. "He advised me to bat deep...I was telling him that hundred is not coming. He told me not to worry," said Gill. Gill scored 130 runs in the third ODI, his maiden international ton.

266.title: Barcelona looking to sign Cavani, Januzaj and Belotti: Report
266.article_body: Barcelona are reportedly looking to further strengthen their attack and are looking to sign Edinson Cavani, Adnan Januzaj and Andrea Belotti. The La Liga giants, despite being cash-strapped, have spent €163.2 million so far this summer. Reports further say the move might come on the last day of the window after Barcelona know of the players that are exiting.

267.title: Amitabh Bachchan tests positive for COVID-19 for the second time
267.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has tested positive for COVID-19 for the second time. He tweeted, "I have just tested COVID-19 positive...All those [who] have been in my vicinity and around me, please get yourself checked and tested also." He earlier tested positive for COVID-19 in July 2020 following which he was hospitalised for 22 days.

268.title: All political parties in favour of freebies: Supreme Court
268.article_body: All political parties including the BJP are in favour of freebies, the Supreme Court said while discussing a PIL opposing the promise of these handouts during elections. The court said that a judicial attempt was made to deal with this. The bench said that it was not against any government policy or scheme and was trying to balance equity.

269.title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests 10 Indian fishermen for poaching
269.article_body: The Sri Lankan Navy has arrested 10 Indian fishermen for allegedly poaching in the country's territorial waters, an official statement read on Tuesday. The fishermen were apprehended on Monday off the northeast coast of Sri Lanka and their trawlers were seized. A Navy attack craft chased the Indian fishermen before the arrests were made, the statement said.

270.title: Unicorn India Ventures to sell stakes in 6 startups to US-based fund
270.article_body: Early-stage investment firm Unicorn India Ventures has decided to sell its stakes in six startups in its portfolio to US-based Continuum Fund for ₹50 crore, doubling returns for Limited Partners (LPs). The startups include Genrobotics, Sequretek, Clootrack, Inc42, Inntot and NeuroEquilibrium. These investments are from the company's first round of funding of ₹100 crore deployed across 17 startups.

271.title: Wasn't allowed to hold him till two and a half months: Dia on son Avyaan
271.article_body: Dia Mirza said her son Avyaan Azad underwent two surgeries right after his birth. "I wasn't even allowed to hold him till two and a half months had passed after he was born," she said. She said that phase of her life was "tough" but she believed that Avyaan would not leave her and "would fight and survive".

272.title: ITBP jawan, his wife killed after truck hits car in Rajasthan
272.article_body: An ITBP head constable and his wife were killed after their car was hit by a truck in the Sadar area of Rajasthan's Sikar district. The couple, Ashok Badhadhara (24) and Ankita (22), were going to Laxmangarh when they met with the accident while overtaking the truck, police said. Notably, the couple have left behind their four-year-old daughter.

273.title: Passage on fertility to be deleted from new Polish school textbook
273.article_body: A school textbook in Poland containing a controversial passage purportedly criticising in vitro fertilisation is being edited, its publisher said. Publishing house Bialy Kruk defended the book but said the passage will be deleted for "social good". The passage reads, "Increasingly sophisticated methods...lead to the treatment of sex as entertainment...who will love the children thus produced?"

274.title: B2B fintech Indium Finance raises ₹4.5 cr from India Angel Network
274.article_body: Mumbai-based Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) Indium Finance has raised ₹4.5 crore from India Angel Network (IAN). IAN lead investors Sanjay Rishi, Raman Roy, and Manipal Group led the round. Founded by Shalabh Mohan and Vivek Kumar in 2019, the company plans to use the capital for acquiring new customers, building the product platform and expanding its sales and technology teams.

275.title: Govt announces rent-free accommodation for 6 months for retired CJIs
275.article_body: The central government on Tuesday notified changes to the Supreme Court Judges Rules, 1959. Chief Justices of India will now get rent-free Type-VIl accommodation in Delhi for six months after demitting office. Further, apex court judges will get round-the-clock security and will also be entitled to a chauffer and a secretarial assistant for one year upon superannuation.

276.title: Shows courage, bravery: Root on Stokes opening up about mental health struggles
276.article_body: England batter Joe Root lauded Ben Stokes for openly speaking about his mental health struggles, saying it shows "great courage and bravery". He added, "We were all there with him going through it. It's not easy to see a close friend and teammate like that, but look at him now." Stokes took an indefinite break from cricket last summer.

277.title: Goa joins 'Save Soil' campaign, signs MoU with Isha Outreach
277.article_body: Joining the 'Save Soil' campaign, the Goa government on Tuesday signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Sadhguru's Isha Outreach. Union Minister of State for Tourism Shripad Naik was also present at the event. "Goa's economy is dependent on soil, whether it is agriculture, mining or tourism. It's our duty to conserve...ecology and environment," Goa CM Pramod Sawant said.

278.title: Same-sex marriage plea hearings shouldn't be telecast: Govt
278.article_body: The Central government has opposed the live streaming of hearing on petitions in the Delhi High Court related to the recognition and registration of same-sex marriages. Stating that there is a possibility of the live stream being edited or morphed, the government said the sanctity of the proceedings could be lost. The petitions have been listed for hearing on Wednesday.

279.title: BSF hands over 2 rescued Bangladeshi fishermen to BGB
279.article_body: The Border Security Force handed over two rescued Bangladeshi fishermen to Border Guard Bangladesh on Tuesday. The fishermen duo, Md Hanif Maula and Md Salim Holder, were rescued by Indian fishermen after their boats capsized due to inclement weather in the Haribhanga river. They were handed over to BGB as a gesture of goodwill and humanity, BSF said.

280.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan gets court summon in contempt case
280.article_body: A Pakistani court on Tuesday summoned former Prime Minister Imran Khan to appear before it next week in connection with contempt charges against him. Khan is alleged to have verbally threatened a judge during a rally over the weekend. If convicted, Khan will be barred from running for public office for life, as per Pakistani law.

281.title: Delhi sees jump in daily COVID-19 caseload with 959 new cases
281.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported 959 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 6.14%, according to data shared by the health department. The city also recorded nine deaths due to the infection. The national capital witnessed a jump in its daily caseload as 625 fresh cases had been logged on the previous day.

282.title: UP CM orders property confiscation of those involved in drug trade
282.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has ordered officials to confiscate properties and put up posters in public places of individuals involved in illicit liquor and drug trade. Following the order, the state government has set up an 'Anti Narcotics Task Force' with powers to search, seize, arrest and investigate. CM Adityanath said involvement in such trade should be a national crime.

283.title: Musk tweets meme as whistleblower claims Twitter lied about spam accounts
283.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted a meme on Tuesday after Twitter's former head of security, Peiter Zatko, claimed the social media platform lied about the number of spam accounts. "Give a little whistle," the meme shared by the Tesla CEO said. Notably, Musk is seeking to pull out of the $44-billion deal to acquire Twitter over spam accounts.

284.title: ‘Unstoppable With NBK 2’ to launch during Dussehra: Reports
284.article_body: Nandamuri Balakrishna will be returning on screens with the sequel of his chat show, 'Unstoppable With NBK 2'. The OTT show will reportedly go live during Dussehra 2022. As per reports, the makers have planned a special launch before the first episode goes live. The makers have also promised that the show will host an interesting lineup of celebrities.

285.title: Farmers should adopt organic farming: Haryana Guv Dattatreya
285.article_body: Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya on Tuesday said farmers should adopt organic farming by taking advantage of the agricultural welfare policies and programmes. Interacting with a delegation of farmers in Telangana, he said, "This'll benefit and help them in becoming self-reliant." Under PM Narendra Modi's leadership, many schemes are being run to promote organic farming in the country, he said.

286.title: UP ex-village head beats Dalit schoolgirl for not wearing uniform
286.article_body: A former village head of UP's Bhadohi allegedly beat a Class 8 Dalit girl and hurled casteist insults because she was not wearing her school uniform. The accused was angered after the girl replied to him that she would wear her uniform when her father buys it for her. The accused was visiting the girl's school during the incident.

287.title: Doja Cat announces her clothing line 'It's Giving'
287.article_body: Singer Doja Cat has announced the launch of her clothing brand, titled It's Giving. The 'Say So' singer on Sunday took to her Instagram account and shared a series of photos in which she modelled a couple of pieces from the apparel line. The collection, which includes t-shirts, shorts, tracksuits and more, is currently available for pre-order.

288.title: Presenter apologises after Man Utd manager swears on camera, says 'Little f-bomb dropped'
288.article_body: Sky Sports presenter David Jones issued an apology on live TV after Manchester United manager Erik Ten Hag swore on the camera after his team defeated Liverpool. "They can f*****g play good football!" Erik said about his players. While apologising, Jones stated, "Sorry...for the language if there was...little f-bomb dropped in there we do apologise." Erik also apologised for it.

289.title: Doesn't make me feel good: Harry Styles on hate against Olivia Wilde
289.article_body: Singer Harry Styles said the hate against Olivia Wilde doesn't make him feel good. Calling it a "difficult feeling", the singer, who is dating Wilde, said he "didn't want to get into it" if he was going to hurt people. Wilde said she doesn't think the hate defines Styles' fanbase. She called the majority of them "true champions of kindness".

290.title: Pakistan to provide troops to Qatar for security during FIFA World Cup
290.article_body: Pakistan's Cabinet on Tuesday approved a draft agreement to provide troops for security at the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. The approval came just ahead of PM Shehbaz Sharif's visit to Qatar. Earlier, both Turkey and NATO had pledged troops to Qatar for the World Cup, with Ankara even training Qatari security personnel ahead of the competition.

291.title: I supported Nupur Sharma: Raj Thackeray on Prophet remarks row
291.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday defended suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma over the remarks she made against Prophet Muhammad. Thackeray claimed Islamic preacher Zakir Naik had earlier made similar comments. "Everybody asked Nupur Sharma to apologise. I supported her...Nobody asked for an apology from him (Zakir Naik)," he said.

292.title: Record number of migrants crossed English Channel to enter UK on Monday
292.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry has registered a new daily record of migrants crossing over to Britain from France. As per ministry data, 1,295 people were found to have crossed the channel into the UK on August 22, beating the previous 24-hour period record set on November 11, 2021, of 1,185 people. This year 22,670 people have crossed the channel.

293.title: Gemma Owen signs six-figure deal with PrettyLittleThing
293.article_body: Model Gemma Owen has signed a six-figure deal with the fashion brand, PrettyLittleThing (PLT). Owen, who called it a "dream come true" partnership, has become the first 'Love Island' star to sign the deal after Molly-Mae Hague. "I'm excited to get to work and start designing some collections for you all," she said. Owen was reportedly "handpicked" for the deal.

294.title: Engine cover of US flight carrying 182 people flies off, passenger shares video
294.article_body: An Alaska Airlines flight had to turn around shortly after departure and make an emergency landing as an engine's cover detached. A passenger recorded a video of the engine cover of the Seattle to San Diego flight flying off as the plane is seen landing. The flight carrying 176 passengers and six crew members, however, landed safely.

295.title: Tamannaah to star in 'Lust Stories 2' with Vijay Varma: Reports
295.article_body: Director Sujoy Ghosh has reportedly roped in actress Tamannaah Bhatia to play the lead of his short film in 'Lust Stories 2'. As per reports, Tamannaah will start shooting for the film next month and she will be joined by Vijay Varma. 'Lust Stories 2' will reportedly also feature short films by R Balki, Amit Ravindernath Sharma and Konkona Sensharma.

296.title: Yash Chopra asked me to work on TV before films, gave SRK's example: Gurmeet
296.article_body: Actor Gurmeet Choudhary revealed that it was filmmaker Yash Chopra who suggested he should take up TV projects before venturing into films. "He'd said, 'If you want to become...film actor, then do TV. Become such a big star in television...that producers and directors would cast you in films, how it'd happened with Shah Rukh.' He gave...Shah Rukh's example," Gurmeet added.

297.title: Holiday in all schools in Jalore district on Wed amid heavy rainfall
297.article_body: Jalore district administration in Rajasthan has declared a holiday in all schools of the district on Wednesday due to heavy rainfall. As per a circular issued by the District Collector, the holiday is applicable only to students, not the teaching staff. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted isolated heavy rainfall and thunderstorms over south-west Rajasthan for Wednesday.

298.title: Sanctioned nearly 5,000 Russians since Ukraine war began: US
298.article_body: The US sanctioned nearly 5,000 Russians, including top leaders, after Russia's invasion of Ukraine began on February 24, said a State Department spokesperson. "We have worked with allies and partners to impose costs, including visa restrictions for Kremlin officials," the official said. The US has warned the Russian Ambassador to the US about the escalation of violence, the spokesperson added.

299.title: Was shocked to see Kohli’s intensity towards training in RCB: Mandeep
299.article_body: Recalling his playing days with Royal Challengers Bangalore, Mandeep Singh, who now represents Delhi Capitals, said, "When I joined RCB, I was shocked to see Virat Kohli's intensity towards training." He added, "His fitness has been instrumental in making him a consistent performer in T20 cricket. It has helped the bowlers improve and has helped Test cricket overall."

300.title: 15-yr-old dies after falling into river while clicking selfie in U'khand
300.article_body: A 15-year-old boy, Manish Uniyal, died in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Tuesday after falling into Bhagirathi river while taking a selfie with his mobile phone, police said. The teenager was alive when he was pulled out of the river by State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) divers, police said, adding he was declared dead by doctors at the hospital.

301.title: Twitter whistleblower claims company lied about spam accounts, CEO Parag responds
301.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal responded after former head of security, Peiter 'Mudge' Zatko, accused the platform of lying about the number of spam accounts. The claims are a "false narrative that is riddled with inconsistencies and inaccuracies, and presented without important context", Agrawal said. Zatko was fired for "ineffective leadership and poor performance" earlier this year, he added.

302.title: Ronaldo can still fit into Manchester United's system: Ten Hag
302.article_body: Manchester United's manager Erik ten Hag said that forward Cristiano Ronaldo can still fit in the team's plan. "I think he can...In his whole career, [he played] under several managers, he did in several styles and systems," Hag said. He added, "For me, his [Ronaldo] age is not an issue. If you...still deliver the performance, you are also good enough."

303.title: Army chief General Pande to visit Nepal in September
303.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande will be embarking on a five-day Nepal visit on September 4. He will hold talks with Nepalese Army chief General Prabhuram Sharma on key issues regarding military cooperation between India and Nepal, official sources said, PTI reported. The visit will be aimed at exploring ways to boost overall strategic ties between the two countries.

304.title: Australia to stop prime ministers from gaining secret powers
304.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese on Tuesday said the government will launch an inquiry to prevent a Prime Minister from ever again amassing new ministerial powers in secret. Former PM Scott Morrison had secretly taken charge of five ministerial roles from March 2020 to May 2021. After the revelation, Solicitor-General Stephen Donaghue said Morrison was "validly appointed" in duplicated portfolios.

305.title: A lot of hate sometimes is entertaining: Johar on 'Koffee...' reactions
305.article_body: Karan Johar opened up about the reactions he gets for his talk show, 'Koffee with Karan', and said the only feedback he takes is "figuring out how to keep it tight, not let...conversation meander too much". He added, "A lot of the hate sometimes is entertaining because I wonder why they are cursing it so much, but also watching it?"

306.title: Ponting, Pant have made DC an extremely professional franchise: Mandeep
306.article_body: Speaking about his IPL franchise Delhi Capitals, batter Mandeep Singh said head coach Ricky Ponting and captain Rishabh Pant have made DC an extremely professional franchise. "Ponting loves discipline and commitments and treats everyone equally," he added. Mandeep has also played for Kolkata Knight Riders, Royal Challengers Bangalore and Punjab Kings. Mandeep played three matches in IPL 2022.

307.title: Ronaldo ignores ex-Liverpool defender Carragher on camera, greets ex-teammates
307.article_body: Before the match against Liverpool, Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo decided to meet and greet his former teammates-turned-TV pundits Roy Keane and Gary Neville while they were on camera. Former Liverpool player Jamie Carragher who was standing between the two though was ignored by Ronaldo. "He totally blanked me," Carragher later said.

308.title: Kenyan group sues UK govt over colonial-era land grab
308.article_body: A group of Kenyans filed a case against the UK government in the European Court of Human Rights on Tuesday. The petitioners are seeking investigation into cases of land theft and atrocities they say were committed in Kenya's Kericho region during British rule. Many in Kericho continue to suffer due to the theft of their land, the UN has said.

309.title: Will not resign despite no-trust vote: Bihar Assembly Speaker
309.article_body: The Bihar Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha said that despite a no-confidence motion moved against him by 55 MLAs of the ruling 'Mahagathbandhan', he will not resign. Claiming that the no-trust vote was based on false charges, he said that resigning will hurt his self-respect. The no-confidence motion was brought without taking care of legislative rules, he added.

310.title: Retired Andhra teacher cheated of ₹21 lakh via WhatsApp message
310.article_body: A retired teacher from Andhra Pradesh lost around ₹21 lakh from her bank account after receiving a WhatsApp message from an unknown number with a link attached to it. The victim said once she clicked on the link, several bank transactions of money withdrawals were made by alleged cybercriminals, who allegedly hacked into her phone.

311.title: Assam students protest against DC for allegedly slapping professor
311.article_body: Hundreds of students on Tuesday held a protest in Assam's Silchar against Deputy Commissioner (DC) of Cachar district, Rohan Kumar Jha. Students of Cachar College claimed that the DC had slapped and verbally abused a professor during the state government's recruitment examination on Sunday. Protesters have threatened to block the next phase of the examination if Jha refuses to apologise.

312.title: Shane Watson names his 5 players for World T20I XI
312.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has named the first five players he would choose to play for a World T20I XI in Australia. He included Pakistan's Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi, India's Suryakumar Yadav, Australia's David Warner and England's Jos Buttler. Talking about Suryakumar, Watson said, "He's batting incredibly well."

313.title: Don't call it COVID, it's just flu; Dravid will be back after taking paracetamols: Shastri
313.article_body: After Rahul Dravid tested positive for COVID-19, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said, "Today, don't call it COVID-19, it's just flu." He added, "This Covid, Covid, you don't talk about Covid now. It's just flu. Take a couple of paracetamols and he'd be back in time for India vs Pakistan." India will face Pakistan in Asia Cup on August 28.

314.title: India forced Twitter to hire a government agent: Whistleblower
314.article_body: Ex-Twitter security chief Peiter Zatko alleged the Indian government forced Twitter to put a government agent on payroll, as per a whistleblower disclosure with US regulators. Zatko said the agent would've had access to sensitive user data. "Twitter didn't...disclose to users that it was believed by...executive team that...Indian government...succeeded in placing agents on [its] payroll," he said.

315.title: TN govt issues glossary to address people from LGBTQIA+ community
315.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has issued a glossary, as suggested by the Madras High Court, explaining how persons belonging to the LGBTQIA+ community should be addressed or described. By doing so, an attempt is being made to address persons belonging to the community with more dignity and respect, the Additional Advocate General said.

316.title: For how long will PM save tainted ministers?: Priyanka on Ajay Mishra
316.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Tuesday criticised Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Kumar Mishra after his "dogs bark on the road or chase the car" remark. "[He's] making statements...degrading the farmers," Priyanka tweeted. Further, she questioned, "For how long will the Prime Minister continue to save the tainted ministers?" Mishra's son is accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence.

317.title: AAP volunteers join Delhi BJP amid rumours of rift
317.article_body: Several volunteers and office bearers of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) have joined the BJP's Delhi unit. Delhi BJP head Adesh Gupta said that the AAP volunteers quit in protest over corruption charges in the excise policy against the Kejriwal government in Delhi. The BJP and AAP have been sparring over the Delhi government's liquor policy being probed by CBI

318.title: India to see 400 mn air travellers in 7-10 yrs: Aviation Minister
318.article_body: India is expected to see 400 million air travellers annually in the next 7-10 years, double the current 200 million, said Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia. He added that he expects India's overall fleet size to almost double to 1,200 in the next 5 years. "We need wide-body aircraft in the country to become an international hub," Scindia added.

319.title: Aware of charges against Khan, want impartial legal process: UN chief
319.article_body: UN chief António Guterres has said that he's aware of terror charges against ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan and has called for "impartial legal process". Guterres' remarks come as Khan was recently booked under a terrorism case for allegedly threatening a judge and two police officials at an event. Khan has been granted pre-arrest bail till August 25 in the matter.

320.title: 'Boycott Bollywood' trend won't last long: Shefali Shah
320.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah, who was most recently seen in the film 'Darlings', has opened up on the 'boycott Bollywood' trend on social media and said, "It's a trend. I don't think it's long-lasting." When asked about the notion that Bollywood is 'dying', Shefali said, "I don't think it's possible. Films are a culture like cricket. It can't die...it can't."

321.title: Healthcare workers real heroes during COVID-19: Mansukh Mandaviya
321.article_body: Praising the work of healthcare workers during the COVID-19 pandemic, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said that they were the real heroes for risking their own health and lives to save patients. Speaking at the Bharat Swaasth Mahotsav, he said that the nation will forever be indebted to them. Further, he added that "the contribution of healthcare professionals is invaluable".

322.title: Before debut, Bobby would never allow himself to get photographed: Rumy Jafry
322.article_body: Filmmaker Rumy Jafry, who penned Bobby Deol's 1997 film 'Aur Pyaar Ho Gaya', in an interview said, "[Bobby] would never allow himself to get photographed [before his debut]." "This was a time when a star used to be properly launched. Hence, he was saving himself for...big screen so that his correct photograph and visuals would be out," Rumy added.

323.title: Hope Kohli doesn't make a comeback against Pakistan at Asia Cup, jokes Akram
323.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, who hasn't scored an international century since November 2019, Wasim Akram jokingly said he hopes that the India batter doesn't make a comeback against Pakistan at upcoming Asia Cup. "For the past year, I'm seeing Indian fans on social media...press having a go at Kohli...He's just 33 and...one of the best of all time," he added.

324.title: If Kohli hits a fifty against Pak, mouths will be shut for the rest of Asia Cup: Shastri
324.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has opined that if Virat Kohli hits a fifty against Pakistan in India's first match of Asia Cup 2022, mouths will be shut for the rest of the tournament. "What's happened in the past is history. Remember, public memory is very short. So it works both ways," Shastri added.

325.title: UP Olympic Association Secy's pics in compromising position with women go viral
325.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Olympic Association's General Secretary Anandeshwar Pandey's pictures in a compromising position with different women went viral on social media. After the pictures were circulated online, the Regional Sports Officer Lucknow Ajay Kumar Sethi sought a report. Sethi stated that Pandey's "illicit activities" are tarnishing the image of Uttar Pradesh.

326.title: Footprints of dinosaur from 113 million years ago spotted in US, pic surfaces
326.article_body: Previously submerged dinosaur footprints have been uncovered in US' Texas after a river dried up due to a drought. A representative of the Dinosaur Valley State Park said that the footprints belonged to an Acrocanthosaurus, a relative of the Tyrannosaurus Rex that stood 15 feet high. The tracks are believed to have been left around 113 million years ago.

327.title: It'll be as holy as Gita: Union Minister Shekhawat on book on PM Modi
327.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat during an event in Rajasthan compared a book titled 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery' with the Bhagavad Gita. "This book will be as holy and important as the Gita updesh (sermons) given by Lord Krishna," said Shekhawat. Congress said the statement is an "insult to the Gita" which "hurts the sentiments of" Indians.

328.title: Process to elect next Congress Prez to conclude by September 21
328.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh said the process to elect the next party President began on August 20 and will conclude by September 21. "The exact date of election will be announced in a few days," he said. On Monday, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the party was 'unanimously in favour of Rahul Gandhi' being the next party President.

329.title: IAF to deploy 2 helicopters for relief operations in flood-hit MP
329.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) will deploy two helicopters to conduct relief operations in flood-hit Vidisha district in MP, officials said on Tuesday. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan was scheduled to conduct an aerial survey of the district. Large parts of the state, including Bhopal, received heavy rain in the last few days, leading to electricity supply disruptions in many places.

330.title: S Jaishankar inaugurates Indian Embassy in Paraguay
330.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has inaugurated the new Indian Embassy in Paraguay's capital Asuncion. After the inauguration, which was attended by Paraguay's Foreign Minister Julio Cesar Arriola, Jaishankar tweeted, "Confident that this new resident mission will take the India-Paraguay relations to greater heights." The embassy began operating at the beginning of this year.

331.title: BJP leader's body found hanging from tree in J&K's Kathua
331.article_body: BJP leader Som Raj was found hanging from a tree under 'mysterious circumstances' in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district, officials said. Raj had been missing for the past few days and his body had blood marks on it, added officials. The police have launched a probe into the matter, with the family alleging that Raj was murdered.

332.title: Taxi driver arrested with Siddique gets bail in Hathras UAPA case
332.article_body: The Allahabad High Court on Tuesday granted bail to Mohammad Alam, who was arrested under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) along with journalist Sidiqque Kappan. Alam was apparently the driver of the taxi which took Kappan to Hathras for meeting the Hathras gangrape victim's family in 2020. "He was just ferrying the passengers in his taxi," Alam's counsel said.

333.title: Give protection to Gotabaya & his family: SL rights body to Prez
333.article_body: Sri Lanka's top human rights body has urged President Ranil Wickremesinghe to provide protection to ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and his family as guaranteed by the Constitution to facilitate the latter's return to the country. The Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka said it had received complaints stating that Rajapaksa resigned amid pressure. Gotabaya Rajapaksa is currently in Thailand.

334.title: 'Realistic' sex doll mistaken for naked corpse on Thai beach, triggers panic
334.article_body: A 'hyper-realistic' sex doll washed ashore on a beach in Thailand, triggering panic among beachgoers who called the police, mistaking it for a naked dead body. Paramedics and police reached the scene and found that the alleged corpse was actually a sex doll costing 20,000 Baht (around ₹44,000). The incident took place at a Bang Saen beach on August 18.

335.title: Debates held in Kerala Assembly over Lok Ayukta (Amendment) Bill
335.article_body: Arguments were seen in the Kerala Assembly on Tuesday over the introduction of the Kerala Lok Ayukta (Amendment) Bill, which proposes the executive be made the appellate authority over reports of the Lok Ayukta. The Congress-led UDF claimed the proposal violated the Constitutional doctrine of separation of powers. Despite the protestations, the bill was sent to the subject committee.

336.title: 'Adani unit bought 29% stake without our consent', says NDTV; issues statement
336.article_body: NDTV said that Adani Group's VCPL acquired control of RRPR Holding Private Limited (which owns 29.18% of NDTV), "without any discussion with NDTV or its founder-promoters Radhika and Pronnoy Roy". RRPR's 99.5% equity shares were acquired by VCPL "without any input from...or consent of the founders", NDTV said, adding that it was made aware of this exercise of rights today.

337.title: MP govt must ensure that farmers get adequate price for garlic: Digvijaya
337.article_body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has said that the Madhya Pradesh government must ensure that farmers get adequate price for garlic. "In...Sehore district, the farmers...were forced to throw away hundreds of quintals of garlic in the Parvati river," Digvijaya said. He added that PM Narendra Modi's promise to double the farmers' income by 2022 has turned out to be a "jumla".

338.title: HIV/AIDS prevalence rate in Mizoram 10 times of national average
338.article_body: The prevalence rate of HIV/AIDS in Mizoram is 2.3%, 10 times higher than the national average, Mizoram State AIDS Control Society (MSACS) said on Tuesday citing a recent survey. Among states, Mizoram now has the highest percentage of population infected with HIV. The state is followed by Nagaland at the second position with 1.45% of its population being infected.

339.title: Well done: Anurag on 17-yr-old GM Praggnanandhaa's win vs world no. 1 Carlsen
339.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur praised India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa following his win against world number one Magnus Carlsen at FTX Crypto Cup in Miami. "Well done...Inspiring rise and game that resulted in the defeat of five-time world champion...Defeating Carlsen thrice in six months is a remarkable feat!" he tweeted. Praggnanandhaa finished runner-up in the event.

340.title: 'Suspicious object' found on wall of police station in Punjab
340.article_body: Police in Punjab said on Tuesday a "suspicious object", which appeared like a pocket transistor, was spotted on the wall of a police station in Ferozepur. According to officials, the anti-bomb disposal squad was immediately informed about the device, but personnel stationed at the station destroyed it using bricks. The SHO said a sand wall was erected near the area.

341.title: ED denies filing money laundering case against Sisodia after announcing move
341.article_body: A senior official of Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday denied registering any case against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 case. This comes hours after ED Additional Director Sonia Narang confirmed to ANI about filing a money laundering case against Sisodia. CBI shared a copy of FIR against Sisodia with ED on Sunday.

342.title: Will restore Ukrainian rule in Crimea: Prez Zelenskyy ahead of I-Day
342.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has vowed to restore Ukrainian rule over Russia-annexed Crimea, a move he claims will be the "biggest anti-war step". Zelenskyy further said that such a step will help re-establish "world law and order". His remarks come ahead of the country's Independence Day, August 24, which also marks six months since Russia invaded Ukraine.

343.title: Canada adds 62 Russian individuals, 1 defence firm to sanctions list
343.article_body: Canada has added 62 Russian individuals and one defence sector entity to its Russian sanctions regime in response to the invasion of Ukraine, Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said in a statement on Tuesday. The freshly sanctioned individuals include Russian federal governors and regional heads, and senior officials of already sanctioned defence firms, Trudeau informed.

344.title: She was like a mother figure to me: Rahul Vaidya after Sonali Phogat's death
344.article_body: Mourning the demise of Bigg Boss 14 contestant and TikTok star Sonali Phogat, singer Rahul Vaidya said, "I'm in deep shock." "She had come for my wedding, and recently when my single released on Friendship Day, she asked me to send...the song," he said, adding, "I wouldn't call her a friend, she was...like a mother figure to me, very affectionate."

345.title: A huge compliment: Archana on being compared to Nawazuddin's 'Haddi' look
345.article_body: Archana Puran Singh has reacted after being compared to Nawazuddin Siddiqui's look in his upcoming film 'Haddi'. She said it's "a huge compliment" to be compared to Nawazuddin in "any way possible". "It's the hairstyle which has become synonymous with me that's causing all these comparisons. I've used this side-parted look during the early part of Kapil show," said Archana.

346.title: Neeraj recovers from groin injury, to participate in Lausanne Diamond League
346.article_body: Tokyo Olympics gold medallist Neeraj Chopra confirmed that he'll be participating in upcoming Lausanne Diamond League 2022. He had pulled out of Commonwealth Games 2022 due to a groin injury sustained in Oregon last month. "Feeling strong and ready for Friday...See you in Lausanne!" tweeted Neeraj. The javelin thrower won India's first-ever silver medal at World Athletics Championships in July.

347.title: Disney appoints ex-Google employee Sajith Sivanandan as head of Hotstar
347.article_body: Disney International has appointed Sajith Sivanandan as Executive Vice President and Head of Disney+ Hotstar who was previously working with Google.
