Sivanandan's role will begin from October, and will report to both Rebecca Campbell, Chairman of Disney's International content and operations group and K Madhavan, President, Disney Star. His role includes overseeing Hotstar's India operations.

348.title: Akshay Kumar & Arshad Warsi to unite for 'Jolly LLB 3': Reports
348.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi will reportedly star in Subhash Kapoor's 'Jolly LLB 3'. Arshad played the titular role in the first instalment of 'Jolly LLB', while Akshay featured in 'Jolly LLB 2', which released in 2017. As per reports, the third instalment, which is based on a relevant topic, will go on floors in the first half of 2023.

349.title: Mumbai-bound IndiGo aircraft develops snag in engine at Goa airport
349.article_body: An IndiGo aircraft carrying 187 passengers, including four infants, developed a snag in its right engine while proceeding to the runway at the Goa airport on Tuesday, a senior official said. The flight was scheduled to fly to Mumbai. All the passengers were disembarked safely by the rescue teams and the aircraft was taken to the taxi bay.

350.title: Man sets self on fire near Maha Vidhan Bhavan over property issue
350.article_body: A man set himself on fire outside the Vidhan Bhavan in Mumbai due to an unresolved property dispute with his brother. Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said he has ordered a probe into the matter and that the man's father had also attempted suicide over the dispute a few months back. The man sustained 15-20% burn injuries.

351.title: Suspended Telangana BJP leader Raja Singh granted bail hours after arrest
351.article_body: Suspended Telangana BJP leader T Raja Singh was granted bail on Tuesday within hours of being arrested after a court returned his remand application. The court has ordered that Singh be released immediately. He was arrested over alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad following massive protests in Hyderabad.

352.title: ED registers money laundering case against Sisodia in Delhi Excise Policy scam
352.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday registered a money laundering case against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia in connection with the Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 case. CBI shared a copy of the FIR against Sisodia and other relevant documents pertaining to the case with ED on Sunday. Sisodia alleged he was "targeted" as he holds a position in Arvind Kejriwal's cabinet.

353.title: Felicitating any accused is wrong: Fadnavis on Bilkis Bano convicts
353.article_body: Reacting to a discussion on the release of the convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that felicitating any convict is wrong. "The accused have been freed after completing nearly 20 years...But it's wrong if any accused is welcomed...There's no justification for this [act]," he said. The convicts were reportedly garlanded after their release.

354.title: Mamaearth tops Practus Hurun India PE Performers ranking
354.article_body: SharkTank host Ghazal Alagh founded Honasa Consumer (Mamaearth) has topped the Practus Hurun India PE Performers 2022 ranking, with a growth of 491% over the last year and pharmaceutical company Encube Ethicals ranked second with a growth of 343%. The report ranks the best performing private equity-backed companies. Sequoia Capital India, Norwest Venture Partners were among the top five investors.

355.title: Want to direct an action film someday: Gulshan Devaiah
355.article_body: Actor Gulshan Devaiah said he would like to direct a film or go back to fashion if he had to make a career switch. The actor said that while he is not yet ready for direction, he would like to "direct an action film someday" without the usual tropes. "I want to approach it like a drama," he added.

356.title: Vijay has been accepting of my opinions on ‘Arjun Reddy’: Ananya
356.article_body: Ananya Panday said she didn't judge Vijay Deverakonda for his film 'Arjun Reddy'. Defending him, Ananya said, "As actors, we are not what we portray on-screen." Ananya said Vijay was "very accepting" of her opinion on the film. The actor had recently said that she wouldn't be or let her friends be in the kind of relationship the film showcases.

357.title: Policeman kills pregnant wife & flees; locals torch his house in J&K
357.article_body: A Special Police Officer (SPO) allegedly bludgeoned his pregnant wife to death in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district on Tuesday following an argument, officials said. The woman's baby died in her womb, officials added. SPO Mohan Lal, who was on leave, fled the murder scene before neighbours arrived. Officials said agitated people torched his house before police controlled the situation.

358.title: India's top order will be delighted by Shaheen's absence at Asia Cup: Styris
358.article_body: Scott Styris has said not just India but every top order will be delighted by Shaheen Shah Afridi's absence at upcoming Asia Cup 2022. "It gives them a greater chance of winning the tournament," he added. Shaheen has been ruled out due to a knee injury. Earlier, Waqar Younis said, "Shaheen's injury [is a] big relief for...Indian top order batsmen."

359.title: Hungary weather service heads fired after inaccurate rain forecast
359.article_body: The two top officials of Hungary’s meteorological service were fired on Monday after they made an inaccurate forecast, which prompted the postponement of a fireworks display on a national holiday. Fireworks in Budapest to commemorate St Stephen's Day were called off after rains were predicted, which turned out to be false. The meteorological service had also reportedly issued an apology.

360.title: Cheteshwar Pujara smashes hundred off 75 balls in one-day match, his 3rd ton in 11 days
360.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara on Tuesday smashed hundred off 75 deliveries while representing Sussex against Middlesex in the Royal London One-Day Cup 2022. Pujara went on to score 132 runs off 90 deliveries in the match. The 34-year-old has now slammed three hundreds in List A cricket in the last 11 days. He also crossed 500 runs in the ongoing tournament.

361.title: SC transfers conman Sukesh & his wife to another jail from Tihar
361.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has ordered that conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar and his wife be moved from Delhi's Tihar Jail to Mandoli Jail in the city. Chandrashekhar and his wife had filed a plea seeking a transfer to a jail outside Delhi alleging a threat to their lives. The conman is in prison on charges of money laundering and duping people.

362.title: Debate on freebies needed for welfare of India: CJI NV Ramana
362.article_body: CJI NV Ramana, while hearing a Supreme Court (SC) petition, said there was a need for a debate on 'freebies' for the welfare of India. "Suppose the Centre makes a law that states cannot give freebies. Will such a law be open for judicial scrutiny?" he asked. He said there was a need to differentiate between 'freebies' and 'welfare schemes'.

363.title: Agencies shouldn't be used in wrong way: Warring on BB Ashu's arrest
363.article_body: Punjab Congress workers along with state chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring on Tuesday protested against the arrest of party leader Bharat Bhushan Ashu and said agencies should not be used in the wrong way. "Ashu Ji's name wasn't even mentioned in the FIR," Warring said. "We're here at Punjab Vigilance Bureau office to ask why was he arrested," he added.

364.title: Illegal liquor factory busted in Jharkhand's Chatra, 4 arrested
364.article_body: An illegal liquor factory was busted and four inter-state smugglers were arrested in Jharkhand's Chatra on Tuesday, police said. The accused were operating the factory in a closed upgraded primary school premises, DSP Kedar Nath Ram said. Altogether 1,854 bottles of illicit liquor and liquor making materials were seized, he said, adding stickers of branded liquor companies were also seized.

365.title: 16-yr-old boy killed over love affair in UP's Barabanki, 3 held
365.article_body: Police on Tuesday said three men were arrested for allegedly killing a 16-year-old boy over a love affair in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki. Suraj Chauhan's body was found on a barb wire in a field on Monday, police added. Chauhan's uncle accused Kallu, Farid and Abid of killing him as he was in love with a girl from their family.

366.title: Mizoram Police seizes heroin worth ₹13.4 crore, 2 arrested
366.article_body: Heroin weighing 2.7 kg worth ₹13.4 crore was recovered by Mizoram Police from Kawnpui town in Kolasib district near the border with Assam, police said in a statement. Two individuals who were allegedly found possessing the contraband were arrested on Monday, police added. According to police, one of the arrested persons is a Myanmar national.

367.title: Govt school teacher suspended for molesting girls on campus in Raj
367.article_body: A government school teacher in Rajasthan's Bharatpur was suspended for allegedly molesting girls on the school campus, officials said on Tuesday. As per reports, local residents blocked roads and barricaded the area as they demanded action against the accused. "I have had a word with the girls. They confirmed the sad incident," District Education Officer Raghunath Khatik said.

368.title: PM to inaugurate ₹660 cr cancer hospital in New Chandigarh on Wed
368.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in New Chandigarh, Punjab, on Wednesday. According to the Health Ministry, the 300-bed hospital has been built by the Centre at a cost of over ₹660 crore and is equipped with modern facilities to treat all types of cancers using every available treatment modality.

369.title: US Embassy issues security alert in Ukraine, urges US citizens to leave
369.article_body: The US Embassy in Kyiv has warned of an increased possibility of Russian military strikes on Ukraine in the coming days around Ukrainian independence day and urged US citizens there to leave if they can. Earlier, Ukraine banned public celebrations in the capital on the anniversary of independence from Soviet rule on Wednesday, citing a heightened threat of attack.

370.title: South Africa, Australia firm favorites to play WTC final: Chopra
370.article_body: Former India batter Aakash Chopra has said that Australia and South Africa are currently the "firm favourites" to play the World Test Championship final in 2023. "Even if Australia win six out of their remaining nine Tests, they will end up on 68.4% (winning percentage), which is marginally ahead of India. This is a major problem," Chopra said.

371.title: 5 Chinese aircraft crossed Taiwan Strait median line, says Taipei
371.article_body: Five Chinese aircraft crossed the Taiwan Strait median line on Tuesday, the Taiwanese defence ministry said. The aircraft were among the 20 Chinese aircraft found operating in Taiwan's vicinity, the ministry informed. China has stepped up military activity around Taiwan since US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taipei visit that took place earlier this month.

372.title: His 'King' title: Deverakonda on a thing he wants to steal from SRK
372.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda in an interview was asked a thing he would want to steal from Shah Rukh Khan, to which he replied, "His King title." The actor, who'll soon be seen in 'Liger', further said he is in no hurry to sign films. "[After] Liger, I'll take some time and listen to stuff and...figure out what I want," Vijay added.

373.title: Govt sacks 3 IAF officers over accidental firing of BrahMos missile into Pakistan
373.article_body: The Centre has sacked three officers of the Indian Air Force (IAF) with immediate effect while holding them responsible for the March 2022 incident where a BrahMos missile misfired, the IAF said. The terminated officers- a Group Captain, a Wing Commander and a Squadron Leader- deviated from SOPs, IAF said. The weapon was accidentally fired into an area in Pakistan.

374.title: Ran away from home at 22, returned only when I became famous: Shehnaaz
374.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill in an interview recalled running away from her home at the age of 22 to pursue her dreams in the entertainment industry. "They'd keep calling me, but I'd put the phone numbers of my family on a blocked list," she added. Shehnaaz further said she returned home only when she became famous.

375.title: Didn't eat meat the day I visited temple: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah amid controversy
375.article_body: Reacting to Karnataka BJP's allegation that ex-CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah visited a temple after eating a non-vegetarian meal, he said he didn't eat meat on that day. "Is eating meat an issue?...I eat both meat and vegetarian food, it's my habit," he said. Siddaramaiah added, "Though there was chicken curry, I ate only bamboo shoot curry and 'akki rotti'."

376.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' becomes highest-grossing Hindi film at int'l box office in 2022
376.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' has become the highest-grossing Hindi film at the international box office in 2022. With earnings of $7.5 million so far at the international box office, 'Laal Singh Chaddha' has surpassed 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' ($7.47 million), 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' ($5.88 million), and 'The Kashmir Files' ($5.7 million).

377.title: India successfully flight tests VL-SRSAM missile system
377.article_body: Indian Navy and Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) successfully flight-tested indigenously designed and developed Vertical Launch Short Range Surface-to-Air Missile (VL-SRSAM) off Odisha's coast. "The missiles, equipped with indigenous Radio Frequency seeker, intercepted the target with high accuracy," Defence Ministry said. The launch was monitored by scientists from DRDO labs.

378.title: Bengaluru's Banashankari temple to be revamped at cost of ₹48 crore
378.article_body: Bengaluru's Sri Banashankari Amma Temple is expected to be revamped at an estimated cost of ₹48 crore. Karnataka minister Shashikala Jolle, after her visit to the temple on Monday, ordered officials to submit a detailed master plan for the overall development of the premises. A permanent roof, 'prasad' distribution counter and seats should be constructed for devotees' convenience, Jolle said.

379.title: Playing Rafael Nadal at US Open would be a nightmare: Nick Kyrgios
379.article_body: On being asked whom he would want to face at Arthur Ashe Stadium in New York ahead of US Open 2022, world number 26 Nick Kyrgios said, "I don't really want to play any of the 'Big 3', you know." He added, "Played Novak Djokovic, I don't want to see him again. Rafael Nadal would be a nightmare there."

380.title: Aadhaar verification now permitted for 8 online Delhi govt services
380.article_body: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has permitted the Delhi government's industries department to accept the Aadhaar card for eight online services. The services include conversion to freehold, the permission of mortgage, application for possession, change of constitution, extending construction time, due payment and refund requests. The Aadhaar-based authentication is voluntary.

381.title: WTC Noida gets 'Premier Accredited Member' status
381.article_body: World Trade Center (WTC), Noida on Tuesday announced it was given the 'Premier Accredited Member' status by the World Trade Centers Association (WTCA). The WTCA is a global network of over 300 mutually supportive businesses across around 100 countries. "The requirements for this program are quite rigorous...could not be more proud of our members," said WTCA Chair, Board of Directors.

382.title: Maharashtra businessman offers Vinod Kambli job with ₹1 lakh per month salary
382.article_body: A Maharashtra businessman named Sandeep Thorat has offered former cricketer Vinod Kambli a job with a salary of ₹1 lakh per month. As per reports, Kambli has been offered a job in the finance division of the Sahyadri Industry Group in Mumbai. This comes after Kambli's interview went viral, wherein he talked about how he is undergoing a financial crunch.

383.title: Woman to sue Nick Kyrgios for accusing her of having 700 drinks at Wimbledon final
383.article_body: The woman, who Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios accused of having 700 drinks during the Wimbledon final, is going to sue Kyrgios for defamation. She stated that Kyrgios defamed her by making "a reckless and entirely baseless allegation". She has instructed her solicitors to start legal proceedings against Kyrgios if he does not offer "a prompt resolution to this matter".

384.title: Time most important thing in construction, govt is not taking decisions on time: Gadkari
384.article_body: While addressing 'NATCON 2022' organised by the Association of Consulting Civil Engineers, Mumbai, Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "Time is the most important thing in construction. Time is the biggest capital." He added, "The biggest problem is [that] the government is not taking decisions on time." Gadkari was dropped from BJP's Parliamentary Board last week.

385.title: Want to remake Mahesh Babu’s 'Businessman' in Hindi: Puri Jagannadh
385.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh said he wants to remake Mahesh Babu's 'Businessman' in Hindi as he feels it will have "great potential in the Hindi belts". He said that in the early 2010s, he had the idea to turn 'Businessman' and his popular film 'Pokiri' into franchises. However, the idea never took off as Mahesh was busy with other projects.

386.title: Not afraid of CBI, I'm an honest person: Delhi Dy CM Manish Sisodia
386.article_body: While addressing a gathering in poll-bound Gujarat's Bhavnagar, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that he's an honest person who's not afraid of CBI. "In Delhi, [AAP has] given 2 lakh government jobs...This growing enthusiasm among people across the country [has made] CBI tighten the noose on me," he said. Sisodia's facing a CBI probe in an alleged liquor scam.

387.title: FIRs filed on complaints of JNU student, staff after clash in campus
387.article_body: Two FIRs have been registered after students and security guards clashed in Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) on Monday. The FIRs have been lodged on separate complaints of a student and JNU's chief security officer under Sections 323 and 34 of IPC, among others. Students involved in the clash over scholarship funds were led by Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP).

388.title: We will see who will stop us: Vijay Deverakonda on #BoycottLiger trend
388.article_body: Reacting to the #BoycottLigerMovie trend on Twitter, actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "We've mother's blessings, people's love, god's support, a fire inside us, we'll see who'll stop us!" He stated, "With Liger we expected a bit of drama...but we'll fight. We've put our heart into making this film. And I believe...I'm correct. I feel that there is no room for fear."

389.title: My no-kissing policy on screen is for life: Actress Jannat Zubair
389.article_body: Actress Jannat Zubair has said that she would follow the 'no-kissing policy' for life. She said her policy is also the reason why she is not focusing on OTT at all. "If it wasn't a well-thought plan, I don't think it would have made to the headlines," she said. Jannat is currently seen on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'.

390.title: Pak killed their chances for WTC final by not producing good wickets: Chopra
390.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra commented on Pakistan's chances to qualify for the World Test Championship final in 2023. "Pakistan have home series against England and New Zealand...But they killed their chances by not producing good wickets when they hosted Australia," Chopra said. He added, "If you continue to prepare such wickets then you won't win."

391.title: Man complains against Zomato for cancelling pizza order in Chandigarh, gets ₹10,000
391.article_body: Zomato has been told to pay ₹10,000 and serve a free meal to a Chandigarh customer who filed a complaint with the State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission over a cancelled pizza order. The penalty was levied since the man, who ordered pizza for his children around 10 pm, was "deprived of food at late night hours", the order said.

392.title: CWG 2022 bronze medallists Treesa-Gayatri reach World C'ships second round
392.article_body: CWG 2022 bronze medal-winning shuttlers Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand reached the second round in women's doubles at World Championships 2022 after defeating the Malaysian duo of Low Yeen Yuan and Valeree Siow 21-11, 21-13 in Tokyo on Tuesday. India's Ishaan Bhatnagar and Tanisha Crasto lost to Thailand's Supak Jomkoh and Supissara Paewsampran 14-21, 17-21 in mixed doubles second round.

393.title: B'luru man dies after motorcycle hits pothole, case filed against BBMP
393.article_body: A 44-year-old man recently fell off his motorcycle after the vehicle hit a pothole in Bengaluru near Sunkadakatte area. Supreeth, who had received head injuries, died on Monday, less than a week after the accident. His brother has filed a police report against authorities of Bengaluru civic body BBMP, charging them with failing to patch potholes and maintain the road.

394.title: 65-year-old man dies of electrocution in Thane
394.article_body: A 65-year-old man died of electrocution in the Upavan area of Thane, Maharashtra. The victim, Bhurao Narayan Chavan, was driving a truck when he noticed a two-wheeler parked in the way, an official said. Chavan got out to move the two-wheeler aside when he came in contact with a metal plate protruding from a distribution panel box, he added.

395.title: Adani to indirectly buy 29% stake in NDTV, launch open offer for another 26%
395.article_body: Adani Group's AMG Media Networks Limited (AMNL) will indirectly buy a 29.18% stake in NDTV and will launch an open offer for a further 26% stake at ₹294/share, the group said in a statement. Calling the acquisition offer "a significant milestone" for AMNL, its CEO and Editor-in-Chief Sanjay Pugalia said, "We look forward to strengthening NDTV's leadership in news delivery."

396.title: 3 petrol pump workers injured as robbers attack them with axe in Pune
396.article_body: Three employees sustained injuries after two masked men attacked them with the blunt side of an axe during an armed robbery at a petrol pump in Pune's Narhe in the early hours of Tuesday. The accused looted ₹20,400 in cash. The incident took place when the filling station was closed and some employees were sleeping in the manager's cabin.

397.title: 3 of family killed, 2 injured as car crashes into tree in UP's Budaun
397.article_body: Police said three members of a family were killed and two others were injured on Tuesday when their car crashed into a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun. The accident took place around 2 am when they were returning from Khatu Shyam temple in Budaun, police added. The deceased were identified as 28-year-old Jyoti alias Ruchi, eight-year-old Shashank and 24-year-old Priyank.

398.title: India awaits evidence from Russia over IS bomber's arrest: Officials
398.article_body: India is awaiting formal sharing of evidence from Russia on the Islamic State (IS) suicide bomber who was arrested in Russia after being accused of plotting an attack in India, government officials have reportedly said. The NIA could step in to probe the matter if Russia hands over conclusive proof, officials said. The terrorist was recruited in Turkey, Russia said.

399.title: 'Bharat Jodo' is the need of the hour: Congress' Jairam Ramesh
399.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from September 7, party MP Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday said it is the need of the hour. "Inflation, GST, unemployment are breaking India. Social polarisation is being done in the name of religion, caste, language, food, clothes," Jairam Ramesh said. "In politics, Centre is overpowering," he added.

400.title: I-T Dept raids offices of real estate firm Phoenix Group in Hyd
400.article_body: Income Tax Department conducted raids on offices of real estate company Phoenix Group and the residences of its Directors in Hyderabad on Tuesday. Nearly 200 income tax officials had flown in from Mumbai to conduct raids at 20 locations over alleged tax evasion. The company's Chairman Emeritus Suresh Chukkapalli is alleged to have close relations with Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS).
